image.altText: Australian Army soldiers prepare to board a US Marine Corps helicopter as part of a bilateral training exercise

props.synopsis: Plans for Japanese forces to train alongside US Marines in northern Australia in 2025 will be discussed during high-level talks hosted by Defence Minister Richard Marles in Darwin today.

title.children: Japanese forces expected to join US Marines for military exercises in Australia next year

image.altText: Katherine Local Court

props.synopsis: The court heard the 17-year-old had a history of severe mental health problems, including psychosis, with her friends and staff at her care home recalling her saying she was “hearing voices” on the night she took her own life.

title.children: Inquest into suicide of 17-year-old girl in care reveals cracks in NT child protection system

image.altText: A man sitting on an Indigenous child (face blurred) on grass, as another man moves his knee towards the child.

props.synopsis: More than a year after former Barkly mayor Jeff McLaughlin was filmed restraining a child in a so-called citizen's arrest, police have closed their investigation into the incident "with no criminal prosecution to occur".

title.children: Former NT outback mayor cleared by police over controversial 'citizen's arrest' video

image.altText: An aerial view of a town

props.synopsis: Despite an aborted manslaughter prosecution last year, the coroner found the mistakes that led to the drowning represented "a systemic issue, rather than a failing of any one person".

title.children: Coroner refers council worker immunity to attorney-general after toddler's drowning death exposes 'inexcusable' failings

image.altText: portrait of middle aged Aboriginal woman

props.synopsis: In a town where unemployment is almost five times the national average, women in Halls Creek are finding much-needed solace and support as they chase their dream job.

title.children: New economic hub gives Kimberley women the support needed to start their own businesses

image.altText: a man, reddened by burns sits in an ambulance

props.synopsis: The harrowing tale of a fishing trip gone wrong, and how three men had to spend a night clinging to their sinking boat.

title.children: How a casual fishing trip turned into a night clinging to a sinking boat, covered in petrol

image.altText: Two police officers in uniform face away from the camera

props.synopsis: Lawyers and Aboriginal police officers have slammed an investigation into racism within the NT Police Force as "flawed" and "an attempt to wipe the slate clean", after the review found no evidence of racist behaviour since 2015.

title.children: 'Effectively became an investigation about nothing': Experts point to flaws in NT police racism review

image.altText: A woman smiles in front of a colourful mural.

props.synopsis: A shopping mall in the heart of Alice Springs became a canvas for cultural expression when it opened in 1987. Now, artists who painted the original murals there are bringing their faded artwork back to life.

title.children: History 'kept alive' as artists return to restore 1980s murals to glorious colour

image.altText: Two aboriginal girls, aged about 10, in front of a pool at night. One is pouring water on her head

props.synopsis: The Garbutt Magpies in Townsville has switched to serving only water alongside healthy food at its Friday night activities for local children, measuring the effects for a type 2 diabetes prevention study.

title.children: Sports club scraps soft drink for research into childhood type 2 diabetes prevention

image.altText: The newspaper column shows a before and after picture of an executive wife.

props.synopsis: In the 1970s, the way a wife conducted herself was almost equally important to her husband's career as his own abilities.

title.children: 'They wanted them to be perfect': The history of Australia's finishing schools for executive wives

image.altText: A photo on a table showing Donna Nelson with her arm around her eldest daughter Ash and another daughter off to the side

props.synopsis: Her daughters say she was lonely and vulnerable. Now Perth grandmother Donna Nelson is about to stand trial in Japan on drug smuggling charges her children believe arose out of a romance scam.

title.children: Daughters cling to hope Japan will acquit Perth mum who they say was victim of romance scam

image.altText: Mike Tyson sits with a towel around his neck

props.synopsis: Mike Tyson's return to the ring played out exactly as everyone expected as the once-feared baddest man in boxing was reduced to an impotent husk. It's why he cannot be allowed to enter the ring again.

title.children: After Jake Paul mocked Mike Tyson, he uttered four words that nobody wanted to hear

image.altText: Prince William leans down with an overgrown beard and his lips pursed.

props.synopsis: Prince William has laid out his vision for his future reign but he is grappling with looming problems, including recent reporting over his inherited duchy, a squabble over a sweetheart rental deal and an ongoing feud with his brother Prince Harry.

title.children: With Prince Andrew given a reprieve from an 'anonymous donor', William inherits his father's real estate woes

image.altText: Elon Musk holds up a fist. He is wearing a gold 'Make America Great Again' baseball cap.

props.synopsis: The tech tycoon, who's already the world's richest man, is believed to have added more than $80 billion to his net worth since the November 5 election, according to estimates from Forbes magazine.

title.children: What Elon Musk could have in store for the US government

image.altText: A black and white photo of a car parked in front of a large house and forest

props.synopsis: What happened inside the house in the early hours of November 13 may never be entirely clear. But decades on, the DeFeo family case has found its resurgence in the true crime sphere, capturing a new audience via podcasts and YouTube videos.

title.children: The DeFeo family went to bed for the last time in November 1974 – hours later, all but one would be dead inside their Amityville home

image.altText: Jaxon Evans's car crashes into the wall

props.synopsis: Sunday's qualifying session at the Adelaide 500 had just seconds remaining when Jaxon Evans lost control of his Chevrolet Camaro on the same corner where three other drivers crashed just days earlier.

title.children: Supercars driver miraculously walks away from high-speed crash at Adelaide 500

image.altText: A bushfire on a horizon

props.synopsis: Bushfires continue to burn in the state's Wimmera region and along the Great Ocean Road, while heavy rainfall and potential flash flooding has been forecast in Gippsland.

title.children: Victoria battles fire and rain as blazes rage in west and severe thunderstorms forecast in east

image.altText: Alex Jones speaks outside the federal courthouse after a bankruptcy hearing in Houston.

props.synopsis: If the sale goes ahead, the Infowars website will be relaunched with satire aimed at conspiracy theorists and right-wing commentators.

title.children: How Sandy Hook families teamed up with The Onion in the battle for Infowars

image.altText: Hard Quiz host Tom Gleeson throws his hands up in the air in frustration

props.synopsis: It's time to test yourself and maybe even brag about it later. But, let's be honest, you'll probably need to keep your score to yourself.

title.children: Hard Quiz: Still think you're smarter than me? Time to prove it, hard and fast

image.altText: An aerial shot of a small town intersected by a highway.

props.synopsis: We see them everywhere — towns along highways that seemingly pop up overnight. So what does it really take to build a town from scratch?

title.children: What happens when you plonk a Woolies in cow paddock?

image.altText: Headshot of tongan king in crown and robe

props.synopsis: This year the Kingdom of Tonga marks 150 years since its monarchy gave up power and drafted a constitution to help ward of colonial powers. But did the king's "English clothes" also help?

title.children: Tonga is the only Pacific nation not to be colonised — so why did their king wear English clothes?

image.altText: Student playing video game on lap top.

props.synopsis: A video game is using real-life scams to teach school students how to detect deepfakes. Try the quiz here, to see if you can spot fraudsters online.

title.children: Are you as scam smart as these 5 graders? Try the quiz made to keep children safe online

image.altText: Man with two girls and two boys in front of a lake

props.synopsis: Every year, 200 men across Australia discover they have breast cancer. Survivors want these men to know they're not alone, even though it might seem like it.

title.children: Men urged to check their pecs after dad's shock breast cancer diagnosis

image.altText: GettyImages-942453

props.synopsis: Russia might only make one trip to the Rugby League World Cup but the memories forged in the 2000 tournament, especially in their record loss to Australia, are wild enough to last a lifetime.

title.children: 'Half-cut from drinking 50 beers on the plane': How Russia took on the Aussies in the most one-sided league Test in history

image.altText: Kelvin Smith wearing a red puffer jacket and beanie plays an upright piano atop kunanyi/Mount Wellington

props.synopsis: Kelvin Smith is known for playing his piano in picturesque locations around Tasmania. His latest feat, pushing his 240 kilogram instrument to the top of Hobart's kunanyi/Mount Wellington, has been six months in the making.

title.children: Tasmanian man pushes piano up mountain to raise awareness of mental health struggles

image.altText: A woman holds a child in her arms after a fire in India

props.synopsis: A fire has torn through a neonatal intensive care unit in a hospital in northern India, killing 10 newborns and injuring 16 others.

title.children: Ten newborns killed as fire engulfs hospital ward in northern India

image.altText: People run as large wave crashes onto pavement.

props.synopsis: Hundreds of thousands of people are ordered to evacuate their homes as the sixth storm to hit the Philippines in a month is upgraded to a "super typhoon".

title.children: Philippines pummelled by 14-metre waves as Super Typhoon Man-yi hits

image.altText: Jai Opetaia stands in boxing stance

props.synopsis: Unified cruiserweight boxing world champion Gilberto Ramírez has called out Australian Jai Opetaia for a world title fight following the Mexican's unanimous points victory over Chris Billam-Smith.

title.children: 'Top dog' Jai Opetaia called out by new champion as Usyk teases return to cruiserweight division

image.altText: An abandoned timber home

props.synopsis: Housing academics say better use could be made of the estimated 100,000 to 150,000 Australian homes that have been left abandoned or empty.

title.children: Abandoned homes pitched as answer to Australia's housing shortage

image.altText: Children's author Mem Fox at Adelaide Writers' Week.

props.synopsis: It might look like child's play, but writing picture books is an exact science. Mem Fox — who has just published her 49th book, Meerkat Mayhem — explains how it's done.

title.children: 'You can't have a syllable out': Mem Fox reveals the magic formula to writing picture books

image.altText: Ashleigh Gentle runs and throws water on her head

props.synopsis: Exhausted Australian triathlete Ashleigh Gentle has battled home third at the T100 world championship, finishing second in the overall season's standings.

title.children: Aussie triathlete earns big payday after inaugural long-distance season

image.altText: A fire truck next to swamp waters

props.synopsis: A 15-year-old girl has died and two other people injured after a single car accident on the Gold Coast this morning.

title.children: Teenage girl killed and two people injured in Gold Coast crash

image.altText: Australian Army soldiers prepare to board a US Marine Corps helicopter as part of a bilateral training exercise

props.synopsis: Plans for Japanese forces to train alongside US Marines in northern Australia in 2025 will be discussed during high-level talks hosted by Defence Minister Richard Marles in Darwin today.

title.children: Japanese forces expected to join US Marines for military exercises in Australia next year

image.altText: Two young football players linking arms

props.synopsis: Private school players are over-represented in the AFL draft, and this year 25 players from the top 30 selections are expected to come from private schools.

title.children: Up and coming Aussie rules stars shrug off private schools' grip on AFL draft

image.altText: A young mum kisses the side of a baby boy's head.

props.synopsis: Chloe struggled with perinatal anxiety and depression, and when her son was born with a heart condition a group of mums rallied — part of a national charity trying to recreate the traditional village.

title.children: When Chloe needed help a group of mums became her village
